rev.comment: trying to put it more neutral, but still needs work
rev.diff:
Line 45: Line 45:
* [[Freedom Toaster]], kiosk-style machines located in South Africa designed to avoid costly and prohibitive download costs. Users provide their own blank CD media and after insertion they can choose a GNU/Linux distribution of their choice to take home.
* [[Freedom Toaster]], kiosk-style machines located in South Africa designed to avoid costly and prohibitive download costs. Users provide their own blank CD media and after insertion they can choose a GNU/Linux distribution of their choice to take home.

===Proprietary projects===
+
===Projects and services===
[[Image:Mark-shuttleworth-launchpad-wiesbaden-big.jpg|thumb|300px|Mark Shuttleworth and other Canonical employees discuss [[Launchpad (website)|Launchpad]] at a design [[Sprint (software development)|sprint]] in Germany.]]
[[Image:Mark-shuttleworth-launchpad-wiesbaden-big.jpg|thumb|300px|Mark Shuttleworth and other Canonical employees discuss [[Launchpad (website)|Launchpad]] at a design [[Sprint (software development)|sprint]] in Germany.]]
Line 57: Line 57:
** '''Blueprints''' - a tool for planning features of software
** '''Blueprints''' - a tool for planning features of software
** '''PPA''' - personal package archives
** '''PPA''' - personal package archives
â
* [[Ubuntu One]], a proprietary service for file synchronisation and other uses where the server side software remains closed. Canonical was criticized in many places for abuse<ref> http://blog.ibeentoubuntu.com/2009/05/about-ubuntuone-post-that-is-sure-to.html / </ref><ref> http://lwn.net/Articles/333073/ </ref><ref> https://bugs.edge.launchpad.net/ubunet/+bug/375345 </ref> of the Ubuntu trademark for commercial exploitation, launching a proprietary service and going back on the Ubuntu promise to keep it free.
+
* [[Ubuntu One]], a closed-source service for file synchronisation and other uses where the server side software remains closed. Canonical was criticizedby some users for abuse<ref> http://blog.ibeentoubuntu.com/2009/05/about-ubuntuone-post-that-is-sure-to.html / </ref><ref> http://lwn.net/Articles/333073/ </ref><ref> https://bugs.edge.launchpad.net/ubunet/+bug/375345 </ref> of the Ubuntu trademark for commercial exploitation, launching a proprietary service and going back on the Ubuntu promise to keep it free.
